body:
I have an application that is designed to do something when the user 
pauses over it with the mouse, especially when the java application is 
unfocused. From what I can tell, on Mac OS X, unfocused Java windows 
don't get mouse events. Other applications in Cocoa seem to get this, 
so I'm curious: Is this a bug? Or was Java for Mac OS X defined this 
way? Is there a way to get these events? 
 
-- 
Brandon Moon
subject: Mouse events on an unfocused window on Mac?
